events.text: You’re late.
I am here now, we cannot do anything about the past.

You say that as if this is the first time you’ve been late.
But never ONCE have you been on time.
I should take my business elsewhere.

So be it.
I need nothing from you, and I doubt you will find a vendor as accommodating as me.

…...
We needed this shipment to have more flavor, you’re sure these have been steeped for longer?
You can check the wooden crates, delivered exactly as ordered.
Then that is all.
I will see you next month. [b]At dawn.
I shall come when I come, [i]Sion.

[b][shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]CAREFUL WITH THE NAME, “M”.[/shake][/b]
Has what little left of your brain rotted to the point of stupidity?
[b]It is a very dangerous and [i]stupid[/i] thing to bite the hand that feeds you.
You’ll regret this.

[b]You will respect me, or you will fear me.
Choose either, but if you choose fear, you may lose your tongue.
You’re scum.

I get things done.
What do you do?
[i]scoff
[color=#ffed29](Scurry back to your master.)
[color=#ffed29](I will be waiting.)
Gramma, you know I love you, and you know I love to hear your voice, but you don’t have to call me first thing in the morning [i]every day.

It’s been a month of this, and it can’t be good for you!
Everyone else in Germanon is sleeping! There isn’t anything for you to do after the call! 
You can’t be waking up at 4:30 AM just to make sure that I haven’t slept through my alarm.

I’m fully 18!
…...

Yeah, I know, Gramma, I’ll always be your little boy. And you’ll always be my favorite person in the world.
……

[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]Even more than Ret Avidine.[/wave]
You know it’s not even a competition. You’re my one and only, always.
......

I love talking to you too, Gramma!
But I think we can probably talk [i]after[/i] my shift so you can get your full 8 hours of beauty sleep.
......
[b]Not that you need it[/b], I know, I know.

I gotta go, I love you! I’ll call you before I go to bed, okay?
We’re gonna start our [b][i]new nightly routine[/i][/b], so you’re not waking up at the crack of dawn anymore.
Bye, Gramma, love you.
Heh…
[color=#ffed29](She’s going to call me tomorrow morning.)

events.choice: It’s time to make a difference.

events.text:
[color=#ffed29](Time to help people.)
[color=#ffed29](Lemme just make sure these legs of mine are working, give em’ a couple jumps.)
[color=#ffed29](Strong as ever, let’s go!)

events.choice: Time to set a new production line PR!

events.text: [color=#ffed29](Today’s the day I beat Herb’s record!)

[color=#ffed29](Sure, he’s still a dozen bottles ahead of me, but I’ll never pass him if I don’t believe I can.)
[color=#ffed29](It might be unfounded, but confidence is good!)

events.choice: “A good world starts with goodness in me.”

events.text:
[color=#ffed29](“Orven Zanry, don’t forget that goodness in the world starts with goodness in you.”)
[color=#ffed29](Gramma, how are you always spitting fire?)

[color=#ffed29](The best thing about waking up so early is passing all the cafes and bakeries.)
[color=#ffed29](Like, the sunrise is always beautiful, but the bakeries!!! This is their time!!!)
Mrs. Langtree! Good morning!
Honey, if you get here any earlier, you’ll be stuck sitting outside of the factory!
I know you wanna get here as early as you can, but I’m telling you, I start at [b]5 AM[/b] on the dot, and I won’t come a minute earlier, do you understand me?
Or you could just give me [i]your[/i] key?

[i]HAHA[/i], my dear, you are way too young to have work be your life.
But I do enjoy our morning conversations. You’re such a sweet boy.
I’ll help you with the second floor and the basement! I know you said your knees were acting up last week.
Orven, you gotta save some of that energy for later!
your “Mister Avidine” is coming today.
But the results of the review are in tomorrow?

events.question: Indeed, they are, but you know how we didn’t do so well the past couple times?

events.text: Wait, what do you mean we didn’t do well?

[b]Remedium[/b] has been trying to be cleared for public distribution.
But I guess our reports aren’t as impressive as they need to be.
So [b]Remedium[/b] has been denied twice?
Yes.

events.choice: Yeah, I heard “the man” failed us twice before.

events.text: Yeah, I mean, “the man” is always trying to keep the little people down, right?

It’s not [i]“the man"[/i]; it’s the apothecaries doing the scientific and safety review for our product.
We’re not against some inscrutable enemy here, child.
I think Mister Avidine knows that the past can weigh on our hearts, so he might say a couple words to help us keep our chins up.
Oh, I’m not worried about that! I’m sure that Mr. Gungand has been working as hard as we have.
Are you worried, Mrs. Langtree?

Hmm…
The only thing I’m worried about is you losing your spirit, child.
Come on, honey, let’s get this place pretty for the boss man.
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]ORVO![/wave]
Herb!! You’re early!

And somehow no matter how early [i]I[/i] am, [i]you[/i] always seem to beat me!
You might as well sleep here, Orvo.
You gotta reign it in. When I meet her, your grandma's gonna kill me if I don’t get you in check.

[color=#ffed29](I’m pretty sure Mrs. Langtree told me how early I’m allowed to come to the factory. I should try to use my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow] to get it right.)
[color=#ffed29](Though if I use my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow], [b]I have to answer quickly.[/b])
[color=#ffed29](And if I get it wrong, I know Mrs. Langtree will be PISSED, since she just told me the time she clocks in.)
[color=#ffed29](Maybe I should play it safe and not try?)
[color=#ffed29](If I don’t remember, it’s best to play it safe.)
Herb, I can come when I please! And if that’s super early, I’m just a super guy.
You’re nuts, man!

[color=#ffed29](I should pay closer attention to what people are saying.)
[color=#ffed29](If I get my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow] right, [b]people usually tell me more than if I don’t use it.)

events.choice: I forgot what time exactly, but I’ll let you know when I’m locked out!

events.text: [color=#ffed29](If I don’t remember, it’s safer to opt out of my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow].)
I guess I’ll find out when I’m locked out!
How about we [i]not[/i] find that out and you just come to work on time?

[color=#ffed29](I should pay closer attention to what people are saying.)
[color=#ffed29](If I get my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow] right, [b]people usually tell me more than if I don’t use it.)
[color=#ffed29](Nice! Let’s get it!)

events.question: [color=#ffed29](But I have to get this right or Mrs. Langtree will think I don’t listen to what she’s saying…and she’ll harp on this for the rest of the week!)

events.text: [color=#ffed29](Oh no! I took too long to think…)
[i]Haha[/i], cat got your tongue?
Give him time, he’s making sure he’s got this right.
[color=#ffed29](I gotta choose my answer quickly if I [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow]. Next time, if I don’t respond in time, I won’t get another shot at answering.)
[color=#ffed29](No, that’s not right, that’s when Gramma wakes up.)
Child! Did you not hear me when I spoke to you?
Ah! No, I’m sorry, Mrs. Langtree. I got confused…
Don’t you be coming here at 4:30 AM, because no one but the cold will greet you.

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1][b]FIVE[/b] in the morning. [b]FIVE.[/b][/shake]
If you can’t follow those instructions, I won’t even let you come in when I do.
You’ll wait for Herwin, you understand?
Understood…
Well, that was rough…
[color=#ffed29](Next time, if I don’t remember, I’ll just stick to what I know. I shouldn’t use my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow].)
[color=#ffed29](That’s it!)
Mrs. Langtree won’t get here a moment earlier than 5:00 AM, and neither will I.

That’s right, honey!
I don’t wanna see your big old eyes any sooner than 5:00 AM. No matter how cute they are.
Also, I’ve been wondering.

Why are you, “Orvo,” and why is Herwin, “Herb?”
You both have such handsome names, you should use them!
[i]Haha[/i], tell her, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][i]HERB.[/i][/wave]
[i]Haha![/i] Well, [i]we[/i] didn’t come up with these names, did we, [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][i]Orvo[/i][/wave]?
You know how Miss Odiche–

Oh, say no more, [i]haha[/i], I should’ve known.
I don’t understand how Willamina gets it wrong when you are [i]speaking[/i] your name to her.
It’s not as if she’s reading it.
[color=#ffed29](No, that’s not right; that’s when Herb gets here.)
Child! Did you not hear me when I spoke to you?
That doesn’t even make sense, boy. I [i]wish[/i] I could get you to come in when everyone else does.
Ah! No, I’m sorry, Mrs. Langtree. I got confused…

If you wanna come in at 6:00 AM, by all means, be my guest!
But if [i]I’m[/i] letting you in every morning, you’ll have the decency to listen to the boundaries I set.

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1][b]FIVE[/b] in the morning. [b]FIVE.[/b][/shake]
If you can’t follow those instructions, I won’t even let you come in when I do.
You’ll wait for Herwin, you understand?
Understood…
Well, that was rough…
[color=#ffed29](Next time, if I don’t remember, I’ll just stick to what I know. I shouldn’t use my [rainbow freq=1.0 sat=0.8 val=0.8]Quick Wit[/rainbow].)
[tornado radius=10.0 freq=1.0 connected=1]Gooood morning, compatriots!
here she comes.
Here we go again…

What an absolutely [tornado radius=10.0 freq=1.0 connected=1][i]gorgeous day[/i][/tornado] for Mister Avidine to grace me with his presence.
It’s like the Sovereign Father coming to meet the Holy Mother: destined, fated, intended–
doomed?
[i]haha[/i], quit it, man! she’s right there!

And that’s all these old ears can take for the day.
See you, [i]“Orvo”[/i] and [i]“Herb.”
See you later, Mrs. Langtree!
See ya, Mrs. Langtree!
The young lads, Herb and [wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1]Orbo[/wave]!
PFFFT!!! OrBo!!!
Good Morning, Miss Odiche, you look really pretty today!

Why, thank you, young Orbo, for noticing my deliberate choice in attire, for it was specifically chosen to be noticed by the wondrous Mister Avidine!
Surely, today will be the day he sees my visage and falls in love, as I have with him!
Isn’t Mister Avidine married?
DUDE!

[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]We…do not speak…of that [b]WITCH[/b] HERE!!!
 [shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]That [b]HARLOT[/b] has him by his throat, but I know that she’s secretly stealing from him everything he has!

Like…his money? But don’t they live together?  
With their kids?
If only it were just his wealth, you silly child, she is taking…
[wave amp=50.0 freq=5.0 connected=1][b]HIS LIFE.
she’s tapped.

Like the blood-sucking vampire she is, she will steal his life away!
His life would be best spent with [b]me[/b].
She is taking his future and his happiness and his fulfillment…
i don’t sound like [i]that[/i], do i???
you’re good, you’re good.
we should probably go, Orvo, it’s way too early for this.
i thought i’d be Orbo?
i can’t keep up with this lady. we’ll take her first attempt and we stick with it.

– take me into his arms and say, “Willamina, you look lovely today, as you do every day. There is no moment when my mind is not thinking about you.” And I will respond, “likewise!” And that will be indicative that we have been of the same mind this entire time! It is love! It has always been love! And finally, my sister will look at me with envy, as I have the most respected and valued man in the whole city beside me! It is my destiny; it has always been my destiny! There is no wasted time, only time waiting for perfection to coincide! There is no possibility of dying alone, there is only patience for the future! With enough time, I’ll be married to Ret Avidine! I’ll be the Mother of the church! And surely when people see my potential, they will have no other choice but to make me mayor! In their awe, how can people not surrender themselves to me??? Willamina, the start of your future begins today!
Ah...
You should really eat before work.
But I love SLEEPING.

events.choice: You’re always so hungry in the morning.

events.text: You’re always so hungry during the morning shift.
Dude, I’m hungry during the afternoon shift, too. There’s no end to this.

I can’t believe you get up early [i]and[/i] you cook all your meals by yourself.
And they’re not even like sandwiches, bro, they’re actual meals.
[i]Haha[/i], it just takes practice. You should help your mom cook!

You’ve got that “sense,” though.
Like, you [i]know[/i] what a dish needs to taste good. I don’t have that.

I’m telling you, it’s all practice!
Trust me, I’ve had a lot of time to get used to spices and seasonings.
Bro, you’re two years younger than me, [i]when[/i] did you have that time???

Orven, you good?
You fidget with your legs whenever you’re nervous…
Ah, sorry!
I just wasn’t super active as a kid.
So when I was in bed, my Gramma would give me food, and I’d guess what she put in there as a game.
My Gramma is super good at cooking, so it was really hard in the beginning because of how many spices she’d use.
Dang, you’d get breakfast in bed??? No wonder you love your grandma.
[i]Haha[/i], yeah.
She’s the best.
Mrs. Langtree!
How were your mornings?

You know, sweaty from working in the hot shop.
You’d think for a factory that used to make elixirs, there’d be an easier, more magical way to blow glass!
Or at least a way to keep us from getting so sweaty.

What you need is a cool towel around your neck.
No need for any weird magic when there’s water and towels!
Magic isn’t weird! You’re just jealous you can’t do any.
Of who? You can’t do it either!
Do you think I can be the best glassblower and not be able to work with elixirs and potions?
So I might not be able to do magic, but I can sure as hell contain it.
Blowing glass isn’t easy. Good work, boys.
Aren’t you excited to see Mister Avidine, Mrs. Langtree?

Child, he’s just a man.
But if he’s coming to say we’re getting raises, I’d gladly join Willamina in his fanclub.
Just wait ‘til you hear him speak, Orven. He’s always well spoken and proper.
Very boss-like.

That’s true. I’m surprised he never wanted to do anything with politics, honestly.
He’s got the oration for it.

events.choice: He’s kind of what I want to be when I grow up.

events.text: He’s kind of who I want to be…
A big boss man, huh?
No, no, just someone who can help a lot of people.

events.choice: I was really helped by him when I was younger.

events.text: He really helped me out when I was young.
How so?
I needed medicine as a kid, so to be able to provide that back to people who needed it, like me, has always been my dream.
Sweet child.

That’s awesome, dude!
You’re going to need to lift if you wanna have people look at you like people look at Mister Avidine.
I know, I know, I’m doing your routine, alright? I just do cardio, too.
You’ll be bigger if you cut cardio out!
No shot, dude, [i]I[/i] don’t need to [i]stop[/i] cardio. [i]You[/i] need to [i]start[/i] cardio.

events.choice: He’s even known in Germanon, isn’t it cool to be that influential?

events.text: Even my little hometown knew about Mister Avidine, isn’t that crazy?
I mean, he’s a noble, so that helps.
But I didn’t hear about that, I heard about how he was innovating on health potions and how it was made to be cheaper so that more people could access them.
[i]And[/i] you’d hear how the Avidines were philanthropists, giving to the church and the orphanage, sponsoring kids.
That’s true, they’re not like the Zergfirs.
That’s for sure, you wouldn’t catch me anywhere [i]near[/i] the Zergfirs.
They’re the other noble family in Ventreville, right?
That’s right, but don’t worry about them. They don’t associate with people like us.
My beloved!!!

…...
…everyone…
Ahem.
Thank you all for bearing with me and my little talks. I know you have better things to do than listen to me.
I know some of you might not know me, and, as the one asking you to do what you’re doing on the daily, I thought it only right to introduce myself.

It is my pleasure to have such talent working for me.
I am Ret Avidine.

But I know there is much to do, and little time to do it.
As you all know, tomorrow, we will once again receive the results of the apothecaries’ review for the clearance of [b]Remedium.
And I just wanted to say,
That I am proud of you.

I am proud of [i]all[/i] of you.
[i]You[/i] are no ordinary man.

And I do not mean “man” in the dividing terms of male and female: I mean it with the collective power of our entire species behind it.
And even amongst the grand populus,
You are no ordinary man.
For the ordinary man is a coward, polluted by cynicism and masked with a proud sneer.
They see man striving towards the boundless sky, and they place themselves above us.

They place themselves with the gods, but they are helpless and powerless in shaping the fate that awaits them.
Though they see themselves on par with divinity, they refuse to risk or tempt or touch the divine power that the gods have bestowed upon us.

They refuse to risk failure.
And they refuse to risk greatness.
…...
But you are no ordinary man.

And I know we are not against any ordinary foe.
We stand against the bellowing and unkind force that is nature. This plague is decisive and cruel.
It does not spare, and it does not relent.
And so the answer to my faith in defeating this foe cannot come from a “[i]what[/i],” but my unshakable resolve comes from the answer of “[i]who[/i].”

WHO are the ones in administration making the hard decisions?
It is Sion Gungand; it is Miss Willamina Odiche…
SQUAWK!

WHO are the ones in the laboratory whose sharp minds push against the boundaries of what we know science to be?
It is…
i didn’t even realize there were that many lab technicians…

WHO are the ones in manufacturing whose strength and dexterity mold the future?
It is…
[color=#ffed29](Don’t tell me…)
…Mrs. Sage Langtree…Herwin Tamboor…and our newest member…
[color=#ffed29](…He knows me?)
Orven Zanry.
It is to all of you I ask this!
WHO can bear the weight of the sky?

ONLY the tallest of men.
You are no ordinary man, you are the tallest of men.
the tallest of men…

And let us be reminded that the answer as to [i]why[/i] we do this is not a “what” but also a “who.”
It is not for the glory, the money, or any political power.
We do this for our mothers and fathers, our wives and our husbands.
We do this for our children and grandchildren!

For the future of humanity!
WE. RISK. FAILURE.

But know this, TALLEST OF MEN!
Our victory is assured.
Those who deride and mock our efforts do not realize that it is not a question of “whether” but “when.”

So perhaps we fail to be approved again; perhaps we fail ten times, a [i]hundred[/i] times to be approved.
This will not stop our relentless efforts, because my unshakable resolve is in [i]you, oh tallest of men.

We will see our children healthy. We will see a world free from this disease.
And those that mock us will then use their mouths to thank us when we have saved this city.

Tallest of men, go,
and with your hands,
HOLD
UP
THE SKY.
[color=#ffed29](That was incredible!...)
[color=#ffed29](Though someone might need to help Miss Odiche, I think she fainted the moment Mister Avidine spoke her name.)
[color=#ffed29](Wow, even Mrs. Langtree is clapping!)
–ARE WE??
[color=#ffed29](What’s Herb chanting?)
WHO ARE WE?!
THE TALLEST OF MEN!
WHO ARE WE?!?!

TALLEST OF MEN!!!
TALLEST OF MEN!!!
[b]TALLEST OF MEN!!!
(whispers)...
You all have the rest of the day off. We’ll see you tomorrow.
[color=#ffed29](I’ve never seen Mrs. Langtree move that fast!)
Orvo, you wanna hit up the Tavern?
Production’s gonna show up and show what these hands can do!
I’m good, Herb, I’ll catch you tomorrow!

events.question: [color=#ffed29](It’s just us. Should I go to him?)

events.text: …Mister Avidine?
Orven Zanry?
Man, I can’t believe you know me by name. I mean, how many people work for you?
And it was so cool how you named all of them!
I mean, Herb and Mrs. Langtree told me you were good at talking, but I mean, I think everyone felt pumped after hearing that.
Did you come up with that on the spot?
What do you think?
With all due respect, sir, no way.
Perceptive.
Did…did you want to speak to me, sir?

[i]sigh
[color=#ffed29](I think I have to go to him.)
I don’t bite, you know.
Ah! Sorry, Gramma always taught me to you know, be a kind of way towards elders.
[shake rate=20.0 level=5 connected=1]NOT THAT YOU’RE OLD.[/shake]
I just…

I know I’ve got a lot to learn, and I want other people to know that I know that.
Like, man, that speech you just gave was…
I could only dream of inspiring people like that.
I think you already do.

With all due respect, sir, no way.
My Gramma doesn’t even trust me to wake up on time!
How could people trust me to do good like how people trust you?

events.question: Do you want to talk in my office or sit outside?

events.text: I guess, your office?
Very well.
It’s nice today, I think this tall man wants to look at the sky.

[i]chuckle
As you wish.
I’m afraid my children would be very jealous if I went to ABP without them.

events.question: Do you want to talk in my office or sit outside?

events.text: I guess, your office?
Very well.
It’s nice today, I think this tall man wants to look at the sky.

[i]chuckle
As you wish.
